Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Jacques Andre DeGraff, Senior Advisor, New York Theological Seminary, 475 Riverside Dr. Ste. 500, New York, NY 10115.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Dickens.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Jacques Andre DeGraff, Senior Advisor, New York Theological Seminary, 475 Riverside Drive Suite 500, New York, N.Y. 10115.

Council Member Dickens moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of July 29 and August 20, 2009 be adopted as printed by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Jackson moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of July 29, 2009 and August 20, 2009 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application nos. C 090307 MMK and shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 090308 ZMK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Eldert Lane Residential Development, Ltd, Brooklyn (C090308ZMK)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation for illegal postings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation for illegal postings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to trash receptacles placed out for collection by the department of sanitation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Trash receptacles placed out for collection by the department of sanitation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting persons receiving public funds or subsidies to be placed in buildings with a history of tenant harassment.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting persons receiving public funds or subsidies to be placed in buildings with a history of tenant harassment.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the Protect Citizens and Residents from Unlawful Detention Act and the Strong Safe Treatment, Avoiding Needless Deaths, and Abuse Reduction in the Detention System (STANDARDS) Act, two bills that will reform the U.S. immigration detention system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Protect Citizens and Residents from Unlawful Detention Act and the Strong Safe Treatment, Avoiding Needless Deaths, and Abuse Reduction in the Detention System (STANDARDS) Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would provide tax incentives for food-service businesses to use environmentally-friendly alternatives to disposable food ware made from Styrofoam and other non-recyclable or non-biodegradable materials.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Provide tax incentives for food-service businesses to use environmentally-friendly alternatives to disposable food ware made from Styrofoam and other non-recyclable or non-biodegradable materials.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass S.1574/A.2656, The Caregiver’s Assistance Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: The Caregiver’s Assistance Act. (S.1574/A.2656)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend section 6-134 of the New York State Election Law in order to extend from three to seven business days a candidate’s time to cure any violations on submitted petitions, and to allow voters to sign multiple petitions without consequence of disqualification.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Extend from 3 to 7 business days a candidate’s time to cure any violations on submitted petitions, and to allow voters to sign multiple petitions without consequence of disqualification.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the States of New York and New Jersey to enact legislation that  dissolves the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor and calling on the United States Congress to grant its consent.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Dissolves the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor and calling on the United States Congress to grant its consent.

Items.Title: Application no. C 060289 ZSX, submitted by City Island Estates, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for a special permit pursuant  to Sections 112-103 (Special height and setback regulations) and Section 23-631 (Maximum Height of Walls and Required Setbacks) of the Zoning Resolution to  facilitate a 43 unit development on property located at 226 Fordham Place (Block 5643, Lot 235). This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City Island Estates, LLC, Bronx (C060289ZMX)

Items.Title: Application no. N 090243 ZRM, submitted by G&R 11th Avenue Associates, LLC pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, relating to Article IX, Chapter 8 (Special West Chelsea District).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).

There is presently one vacant Council seat (10th Council District, Manhattan).
